contentList.content: 0 = no debug, 1 = minimal, 2 = verbose debug logs.
Whether to teleport party members after some time and distance after jumping.

Distance threshold in meters for teleporting party members.
Members will be teleported if they are X meters away from the jumper.
3m = ~10ft

Interval in seconds between distance checks after jumping.
Will periodically check if party members have crossed the distance threshold.
This check is repeated every X seconds until the time threshold (set below) is reached.

Time threshold to stop checking for distance after jumping.
After this number of seconds, the mod will stop checking if party members crossed the distance threshold.
Keybind to teleport party members to the current character.

Whether to ignore teleporting party members if jumper took fall damage.
Due to API limitations, it does not check for actual fall damage; this verification is just an approximation.
Whether to apply fall damage to party members after teleporting if jumper took fall damage.
Whether to buff the jump distance for other characters so that they may try to keep up.
Whether to buff jump distance for companions right when your character jumps.
Whether to only help party members that are grouped or linked to the jumper/controlled character.
If enabled, only party members with STR equal or higher than the jumper/controlled character will be helped
Keybindings/buttons that allow you to teleport the party to you manually.
Teleports the party to you by pressing this key combination.
Temporarily boosts jumping capabilities outside of combat. Added by Fix Stragglers.

These settings allow you to optionally configure the teleporting method.
The defaults should work for most cases, feel free to report better values on Nexus.
Enable teleporting method (distance-based, without having jumped)

Whether to teleport linked party members if they are too far away from the controlled character.
Does not depend on jumps.

Distance threshold in meters for teleporting party members.
Members will be teleported if they are X meters away from the controlled character, regardless of jumps.
10m = ~32ft
What visual effect to apply when teleporting characters. Pick NONE to disable.
Whether to ignore summons when teleporting/helping party members.
Teleport party members to the location of your character regardless of your settings (combat, etc).
Teleport party members to the location of your character according to your settings.
These settings allow you to teleport party members if they are too far away from the controlled character, regardless of jumps.
Ignore party members that are in a 'restricted' state: in Danger Zone or affected by movement/fast travel restrictions (arrested, camp night, etc).
Ignore party members that are in dialogue.
Always force teleport the party to you, even if some restrictions would normally block it.
